*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.1.2 cloud via packages - [environment.yml|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.1/139/artifact/environment.yml/*view*/]
# Enable Eucalyptus DNS
# Create EBS-backed EMI, and launch an instance using block-device-mapping flag 
# After the instance has successfully launched, use euca-create-image to create an EMI from the instance.
fields.summary: EMI created from euca-create-image constantly adds block device mapping

comments.body:
The log file is filled with the error -- Tue Jul 21 15:24:42 2015 ERROR [CreateImageTask:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:ListenerRegistry:listenerTasks.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#13345] Unable to find the vm instance (terminated?) - i-25855b16

CreateImage expects the instance is running so terminating it would have impact here.

Fix is pushed to maint-4.1. 

It is not expected that VM instances are terminated right after create-image is called. It is because the snapshot for the new image should be cloned from the instance's volume.

When it happens, the resulting image's state will eventually be 'failed' but the state transition would take some time (1 hour). We may want to create another ticket to address faster state transition.

Tickets have been created and linked:

* EUCA-11180
* EUCA-11181

Will kick off new job to test fix in maint-4.1 branch, and report results.
[~hspencer] Your AWS test is very useful. Thanks!

[~spark],

Issue still exists.  I was able to re-create the issue by doing consecutive CreateImage calls on different EBS-backed instances.  One EMI went to 'failed' state.  The other shows the repeating block device mapping information.  The cloud used to reproduce this issue can be used for triage by Engineering - [hspencer-146|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.1/146/]

Version of Eucalyptus: {{4.1.2-0.0.23231.102.20150707git35ff392.el6}}

With the fix, the image will go to 'failed' as soon as the instance become terminated.

Issue has been fixed.  Failed EMIs go to 'failed' state immediately when the instance reaches 'terminated' state.  However, please check EUCA-11184.  Currently, failed EMIs from CreateImage will sometimes leave behind snapshots.

# Launch another instance from the EBS-backed EMI with block device mapping flag for adding a 5 gig volume
# Wait 10 seconds, then run TerminateInstances against the EBS-backed instance used with CreateImage
# Launch another instance from the EBS-backed EMI with no block device mapping
# Run TerminateInstances against the EBS-backed instance used with CreateImage
# Notice all the EMIs associated with failed CreateImage reach 'failed' state once instances are terminated.
